disasters.summary: A devastating earthquake struck southeastern Turkey, affecting multiple provinces and causing widespread destruction to residential buildings and critical infrastructure.
Major forest fires swept through Muğla and Antalya provinces, destroying thousands of hectares of forest and threatening coastal tourist areas.
Flash flooding struck Istanbul and Ankara, causing widespread urban disruption and infrastructure damage.
Record flooding hit Kyiv, submerging coastal areas and causing significant property damage across the capital.
Major spring flooding affected western Kazakhstan, displacing over 120,000 people and causing extensive damage to rural infrastructure.
Flash flooding affected Tbilisi and surrounding regions, causing fatalities and significant infrastructure damage.
Major flooding affected northern Albania, displacing thousands of residents and causing extensive damage to homes and infrastructure.
Autumn flooding hit Podgorica and Nikšić regions, causing damage to homes and local infrastructure.
